scriptures.content: Abraham took another wife, whose name was Keturah.
<crossref let="l" cid="c01025002.1"/>She bore him Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah.
Jokshan fathered Sheba and Dedan. The sons of Dedan were Asshurim, Letushim, and Leummim.
The sons of Midian were Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the children of Keturah.
<crossref let="m" cid="c01025005.1"/>Abraham gave all he had to Isaac.

But to the sons of his concubines Abraham gave gifts, and while he was still living he <crossref let="n" cid="c01025006.1"/>sent them away from his son Isaac, eastward <crossref let="o" cid="c01025006.2"/>to the east country.
These are the days of the years of Abraham's life, 175 years.
Abraham <crossref let="p" cid="c01025008.1"/>breathed his last and <crossref let="q" cid="c01025008.2"/>died in a good old age, an old man and full of years, and was gathered to his people.
Isaac and Ishmael <crossref let="r" cid="c01025009.1"/>his sons buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron the son of Zohar the Hittite, east of Mamre,
the field <crossref let="s" cid="c01025010.1"/>that Abraham purchased from the Hittites. <crossref let="t" cid="c01025010.2"/>There Abraham was buried, with Sarah his wife.
After the death of Abraham, God blessed Isaac his son. And Isaac settled at <crossref let="u" cid="c01025011.1"/>Beer-lahai-roi.
These are the generations of Ishmael, Abraham's son, <crossref let="v" cid="c01025012.1"/>whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah's servant, bore to Abraham.

<crossref let="w" cid="c01025013.1"/>These are the names of the sons of Ishmael, named in the order of their birth: <crossref let="x" cid="c01025013.2"/>Nebaioth, the firstborn of Ishmael; and <crossref let="x" cid="c01025013.3"/>Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
Mishma, Dumah, Massa,
Hadad, <crossref let="y" cid="c01025015.1"/>Tema, <crossref let="z" cid="c01025015.2"/>Jetur, <crossref let="z" cid="c01025015.3"/>Naphish, and Kedemah.
These are the sons of Ishmael and these are their names, by their villages and by their encampments, <crossref let="a" cid="c01025016.1"/>twelve princes according to their tribes.
(These are the years of the life of Ishmael: 137 years. He <crossref let="b" cid="c01025017.1"/>breathed his last and died, and was gathered to his people. )
They settled from Havilah to Shur, which is opposite Egypt in the direction of Assyria. He settledHebrew fell over against all his kinsmen.
These are the generations of Isaac, Abraham's son: <crossref let="e" cid="c01025019.1"/>Abraham fathered Isaac,
scriptures.section_title: The Birth of Esau and Jacob

scriptures.content: and Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah, <crossref let="f" cid="c01025020.1"/>the daughter of Bethuel the Aramean of <crossref let="g" cid="c01025020.2"/>Paddan-aram, <crossref let="h" cid="c01025020.3"/>the sister of Laban the Aramean, to be his wife.
scriptures.section_title: The Birth of Esau and Jacob

scriptures.content: And Isaac prayed to the Lord for his wife, because she was barren. And the Lord granted his prayer, and Rebekah his wife conceived.
scriptures.section_title: The Birth of Esau and Jacob

scriptures.content: The children struggled together within her, and she said, "If it is thus, why is this happening to me?"Or why do I live? So she went to inquire of the Lord.
scriptures.section_title: The Birth of Esau and Jacob

scriptures.content:
And the Lord said to her,"Two nations are in your womb,
and two peoples from within youOr from birth shall be divided;
the one shall be stronger than the other,
the older shall serve the younger. "
scriptures.section_title: The Birth of Esau and Jacob

scriptures.content: When her days to give birth were completed, behold, there were twins in her womb.
scriptures.section_title: The Birth of Esau and Jacob

scriptures.content: The first came out red, <crossref let="n" cid="c01025025.1"/>all his body like a hairy cloak, so they called his name Esau.
scriptures.section_title: The Birth of Esau and Jacob

scriptures.content: Afterward his brother came out with his hand holding Esau's heel, so his name was called Jacob. Jacob means He takes by the heel, or He cheats Isaac was sixty years old when she bore them.
scriptures.section_title: The Birth of Esau and Jacob

scriptures.content: When the boys grew up, Esau was <crossref let="q" cid="c01025027.1"/>a skillful hunter, a man of the field, while Jacob was a quiet man, <crossref let="r" cid="c01025027.2"/>dwelling in tents.
scriptures.section_title: The Birth of Esau and Jacob

scriptures.content: Isaac loved Esau because <crossref let="s" cid="c01025028.1"/>he ate of his game, but Rebekah loved Jacob.
scriptures.section_title: The Birth of Esau and Jacob

scriptures.content: Once when Jacob was cooking stew, Esau came in from the field, and he was exhausted.
And Esau said to Jacob, "Let me eat some of that red stew, for I am exhausted!" (Therefore his name was called Edom. Edom sounds like the Hebrew for red)
Jacob said, "Sell me your birthright now. "
Esau said, "I am about to die; of what use is a birthright to me?"
Jacob said, "Swear to me now. " So he swore to him and <crossref let="t" cid="c01025033.1"/>sold his birthright to Jacob.
Then Jacob gave Esau bread and lentil stew, and he ate and drank and rose and went his way. Thus Esau despised his birthright. <end-chapter/>

n01025030.1.content: Edom sounds like the Hebrew for red

n01025026.1.content: Jacob means He takes by the heel, or He cheats
